content.description: Climb small crimps to arete on left and top out. Used to be a sit start. I believe holds broke off. I start standing... The crimps to the arete are fun. The top out is not as much fun...
content.location: On other side of 'Grease Monkey'. From the 'Razor Edge' and 'Simple Solution' follow the trail past 'Book of Fun' and scramble over a few small boulders. This is not actually on the world boulder. It is in the shorter boulders below it.

content.description: From Karabin guide: "Stand start with good edge, climb over up crack to top."
content.location: 15 feet to the right of "Wheat Thin"

content.description: Climb slab to the right of 'Book of Fun'.
content.location: This is not actually on the world boulder. It is in the shorter boulders below it.

content.description: Same start as arrowhead. Instead of traversing top out.
content.location: This is a large boulder that faces the world boulder. The boulder is on the south east side of the world boulder (downhill and down canyon side).

content.description: Karabin guide - "Sit down big flake start, climb L onto easy slick slab arete."
content.location: To the right of "Projected," ~10 feet left of "Sunday School."

content.description: Sit start. Move up thin crimps to top out.
content.location: To the left (east) of 'Razors Edge'. This problem starts right in front of the small tree and to the side of a small boulder wedged into the rock.

content.description: Sit start up big jugs and blocky rock.  Good rock quality.
content.location: Follow closely along the rock for 150' from climbers right of Air Leeches.  Walk off to the right.

content.description: Start matched on a block and gastone out right to a rounded edge and fallow it out a few moves and then shift over left to a jug and top out of left side of boulder.
content.location: On Schneblys Roof

content.description: Sit start. Follow large edges to top out. Very positive and solid holds!
content.location: When scrambling up to the world boulder it is the boulder on the right. This is the first problem on the edge of the boulder. This is not actually on the world boulder. It is in the shorter boulders below it.

content.description: Karabin guide "Sit down start on sloping holds, slap lip, climb to top." Looks like one of the sloping holds may have broken off.
content.location: Around the corner from Two Scoops

content.description: Start using a large block.  Mantle on the block to get into a left leaning thin crack.  Follow the crack up to where the angle eases off and continue up slick slab to top.
content.location: 10' to the right of Air Leeches.  Obvious block start.  Walk off right.

content.description: Sit down start on positive edges.  Climb up using sidepulls to the smooth slab and follow to the top.
content.location: 20' climbers right of Air Leeches.  Start is a few feet right of large block that is the start of Outer Limits.

content.description: Start on detached flake and move along good holds out right. Big move to a horn then bomber holds to lip. Pop over lip for a long reach to a less than perfect top out hold.
content.location: This route is between the wash and the up canyon side of the world boulder. It is about 50 yards from the wash.

content.description: Start on a jug right below a thin crack.  Move up crack and follow the slab to the top.
content.location: 30' climbers right of Air Leeches.

content.description: Start in a clean looking smooth open book.  Stem up  using sidepulls and some slopey holds.  Then move right to the top.  Tall problem.
content.location: About 100' feet to the climbers right from Air Leeches.  Obvious clean open book start.

content.description: Climb the thin crimps, pray that none of them break, top out using the non existent dish. Topping is the crux!
content.protection: pads and spotters (notice both are plural!)
content.location: Across from Book of Fun. This is not actually on the world boulder. It is in the shorter boulders below it.

content.description: Start on a blocky sidepull just left of  the open book.  Stem up  into a finger crack, and then a bit higher a hand crack.  Step out onto the arete on the left and continue on to the top.
content.location: 100' to the climbers right of Air Leeches.  Once you top out walk right over big blocks to walk off or downclimb Sage.

content.description: Sit start on Razors edge. Traverse entire wall to the Book of Fun.
content.location: When scrambling up to the world boulder it is the boulder on the right. This is the first problem on the edge of the boulder. This is not actually on the world boulder. It is in the shorter boulders below it.

content.description: It's kinda contrived, but go with it on this one! Climb low angle slabs without hands. Two opposing slabs meet to form a seam. It looks like a book...
content.location: Last problem on left (furthest downhill) of boulder with 'razors edge'. This is not actually on the world boulder. It is in the shorter boulders below it.

content.description: Far right(west) side of face that faces the world boulder. Sit start. Traverse left. Top out over boulder.
content.location: This is a large boulder that faces the world boulder. The boulder is on the south east side of the world boulder (downhill and down canyon side).

content.description: Splitter crack. Slightly overhung. Highball.
content.protection: Pads and a big set of balls. Or top rope.
content.location: The obvious crack on the world boulder.

content.description: Climb thin flakes. Scramble up back to set up top rope.
content.location: Obvious face on left side of the south face of world boulder.

content.description: A bunch of short V0's! This is a great place for the V0 to V2 climber!
